primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God justifies the ungodly by 'reckoning' righteousness to them as a unilateral gift, thereby dissolving human hierarchies and enabling new life.

tekstueel_bewijs: Credit comes to him as a pure, unearned gift
God didn’t say... if you’re righteous... He just said, 'I will bless you.'

ontvanger.identificatie: The Ungodly (Abraham, the Hearer, the 'Basement Man')
tekstueel_bewijs: written not for his sake alone, but for ours also
we are a community of sinners
reckoned righteous by God through faith in Jesus
beholding us ungodly offenders through the eyes of his beloved Son
everything that separates us from each other
it is a form of idolatry
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The preacher identifies the 'religious life' as a form of idolatry that leads to 'death,' making the opponent an ontological threat rather than a mere moral lapse.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The response of the justified community: ethical action and the restoration of buildings as an act of worship.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Justified Community
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program (ethics) is explicitly described as a 'product' or 'shape' that follows the primary 'force of the divine logizomai'.

voorbeelden_god_subject: God has unilaterally reckoned us righteous.
God creates righteousness where there was none before.
voorbeelden_mens_subject: Abraham did not get close to God.
We are daily rediscovering our utter dependence.

voorbeelden: Are we then to continue in sin?
Paul wants to show us... what the true foundation is
power to make godliness out of ungodliness
overtakes and surpasses our narrow capabilities

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on God's 'Power' (Pouvoir) to justify and transform, rather than the hearer's 'Obligation' (Devoir). Grace is presented as the endowment of competence.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From S2 (Death/Distinction) through ~S1 (Religious Merit) to ~S2 (The Ungodly) and finally to S1 (Grace).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by God's unilateral action which redefines the 'Ungodly' (~S2) as 'Righteous' (S1).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; the preacher explicitly states that idealizing religious figures 'leads to death'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is rigorously theocentric. It systematically deconstructs human merit and places God as the sole active Subject of salvation.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: Abraham was considered to be the model...

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: Abraham did not get close to God; God came close to him.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: The preacher explicitly attacks exemplarism, calling the imitation of religious models 'dead wrong' and 'idolatry'.
bijbelse_figuren_als_model: Abraham (rejected as model, used as proof of ungodliness)
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Abraham is the proof that God justifies the ungodly, not a hero to be imitated.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief from anxiety; dissolution of spiritual hierarchy.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Sola Gratia; the hearer is passive in justification.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the 'Fundamental Program' (Justification) to the 'Secondary Program' (Building Fund) is handled with extreme care to avoid moralism.
spanning_punten: The 'But does this mean we don't have to do anything?' objection is raised and answered via the 'longing' created by grace.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: beholding us ungodly offenders through the eyes of his beloved Son

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The 'power' to make godliness is an endowment following justification.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully maintains God as the Subject. The narrative engine is fueled by God's unilateral 'reckoning' rather than human 'becoming'.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain as is; this is a classic 'Lent' correction of legalism.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: The opponent (religious pride) is already treated as a 'deadly' threat.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterclass in theocentric preaching that uses the Actantial model to dismantle human ego.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'Southern' anecdotes, Greimasian analysis reveals the basement man is an actantial 'Receiver' equal to the 'Subject-Abraham'.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains 'logizomai'; semiotics shows how 'logizomai' functions as the 'Object' that God (Subject) transfers to the Hearer (Receiver).
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the sermon's power comes from the 'Subject-Switch' where God takes over the active verbs usually reserved for the 'religious' person.

appendices.notities: The sermon uses the building fund as a 'test case' for the actantial structure, ensuring the congregation doesn't become the 'Subject' of their own merit.
